bill_title: to revise certain real estate licensing application and examination procedures and to authorize the increase of license application fees.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain real estate licensing application and examination procedures and to authorize the increase of license application fees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-21A-41 be amended to read as follows: 36-21A-41. No person may be licensed until he has qualified by examination, except as otherwise provided by this chapter. An individual who fails the examination may take a second examination within nine months from the notification by the commission of his failure. If an applicant fails the test the second time or if the applicant fails to take a second test within the nine-month period, his application is void, but he may submit a new application accompanied by a new filing fee and again be eligible for examination. Section 2. That § 36-21A-42 be amended to read as follows: 36-21A-42. An applicant A person is required to retake only the failed portions of the examination that he failed . If he the person fails any part twice, he the person shall make a new application and rewrite both parts of the examination. Section 3. That chapter 36-21A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Upon notification in writing that the person has passed the examination, the person shall file the appropriate application for license with all the required documents to the Real Estate Commission within sixty days of the notice date. If the person fails to file an application and proof of required education within the sixty-day period, the person's registration and all rights deriving from a passing score are canceled. Section 4. That § 36-21A-43 be amended to read as follows: 36-21A-43. An applicant currently licensed in another state who , within the last five years, has successfully passed the real estate licensing examination given in another state need not take the uniform only take the state portion of the examination in South Dakota. Section 5. That § 36-21A-49 be amended to read as follows: 36-21A-49. The commission shall set, by rule promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, an application fee not to exceed one two hundred dollars. This fee shall accompany an application for a real estate salesman's salesperson's, broker associate's, or broker's license including restricted licenses. If the applicant successfully passes the examination, no additional fee is required for the issuance of a license. If the applicant fails the examination, he shall pay an additional twenty-five dollars before he may take a succeeding examination. If a new application is necessary, the applicant shall submit with his application a fee set by rule promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26. This fee may not exceed one hundred dollars. A second examination, if necessary in connection with the new application, shall be accompanied by an additional twenty-five dollar fee.
